thread.title: NFL star Larry Fitzgerald passes praise to famed archaeologist | Page Six
thread.title_full: NFL star Larry Fitzgerald passes praise to famed archaeologist | Page Six

author: Emily Smith
title: NFL star Larry Fitzgerald passes praise to famed archaeologist | Page Six
text:
When the crowd at the Waste Management Phoenix Open started chanting “Larry, Larry!” NFL great Larry Fitzgerald wasted no time in giving credit where it was due.
The wide receiver said, “I don’t think it was for me. Seriously. There was another Larry in our group. They were cheering for Larry Coben — the famous archaeologist. Seriously. He’s the best in the world. I’m not even the best in the world anymore, you know what I’m saying?”
Fitzgerald plays for the Arizona Cardinals. Coben, who is investigating Incan mysteries, laughingly accepted the accolade, telling Page Six, “An archaeologist having 15 minutes of fame is rarer than Indiana Jones finding the Holy Grail.”
